attributes.action: Stop the knife angel made up of Murder weapons being placed in our city.
attributes.additional_details: THE COMMUNITY ARE ASKING TO BE HEARD! No one feels like they have been consulted. How is this going to benefit society? Do the families really need to go into central London and see this as a constant reminder .How about those that have not yet had justice. Could the evidence of been sterilised and melted down? It has been created as a memorial when actually its insulting and in sensitive. Put something in London that promotes the positivity of our young people. share that with the world !
attributes.background: There are concerns that the community have not been consulted in the development of the Knife Angel .The British Iron work centre state  they have received support for its development. That is not evidenced anywhere.We do however support the removal of the weapons of our streets but not the angel!

rejection.details:
A decision about where to place a statue would be the decision of your local authority, not the UK Government and Parliament.

You could raise this issue with a local councillor, who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them:

https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors
